noun.description: A unit of pronunciation having one vowel sound, with or without surrounding consonants, forming the whole or a part of a word; e.g., there are two syllables in water and three in inferno.

verb.description: Pronounce (a word or phrase) clearly, syllable by syllable.

origin: Late Middle English: from an Anglo-Norman French alteration of Old French sillabe, via Latin from Greek sullabē, from sun- together + lambanein take.
